engineering_design_principles.mechanism: A mechanism to maintain the stability of a system by regulating its variables through continuous monitoring and adjustment.
The unexpected and complex behaviors that arise from the interactions of simpler components within a system.
The process of configuring a system to perform its functions at the highest level of efficiency and effectiveness.
The duplication of system components to increase its resilience and stability by providing backup or alternative solutions.
The deliberate positioning of components within a system to optimize their performance, efficiency, or effectiveness.
